alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 22 at 9:30AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Falls Creek. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Significant runoff may cause flooding of creeks and rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 926 AM AKDT, Falls Creek has crested as of 4 am at a level of 23.8 feet, and is falling this morning. At 9 am the creek level is 23.1 feet, and flood stage is 22.5 feet. Satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding of small streams, especially near Falls Creek. Between 1.5 and 3.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are possible. - The ongoing rains could swamp boats. Mariners should check their vessels immediately.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
